summary: This bill, the Producing Advanced Technologies for Homeland Security Act (PATHS Act), aims to enhance the Department of Homeland Security's (DHS) ability to utilize secure and trustworthy technology. It primarily focuses on extending and modifying the research and development acquisition pilot program established by the Homeland Security Act of 2002. Key provisions include extending the program's deadline to September 30, 2028, and mandating notification to relevant congressional committees regarding the use of other transaction authority involving artificial intelligence. The bill also reduces the threshold for certain contract awards.
